result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Erwin Jay Pruitt in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Defendant Erwin Jay Pruitt in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Upon plea to Ct 2 in 14CF1748, Bal is DRI. Pl to 14CF1413 w/o repeater, State moves to DRI 14CF586. State recommends I/s prison-amount determined by the Court. 2 yrs probation, absolute sobriety, conditional jail time-amount determined by the Court.
P-NC to both
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

Defense is asking for bond to be modified to $500.00. The State objects to any modification of bond citing defendant's track record on bond.

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered. Bond modificaton is granted in 14CF1413 - $1,000.00 cash. 14CF1748-$1000.00 cash. Previous conditons of both bonds remain  
          Bond remains in 14CF586

Defendant Erwin J Pruitt in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
MIL's by parties agreed upon. No Daubert issues, the State indicates that all but 2 witnesses are available. The State can go forward w/o the officer witness and the citizen witness is expected to be served. Parties expect the trial to last 2 1/2 days or so. 1 alternate, 5 strikes.
The Court will give preliminary instructions #50, 103, 148, 55, 300, 140, 101. Parties agree. Ludwig hearing conducted before voir dire.

Preliminary hearing on May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:    It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Erwin Jay Pruitt in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Erwin Jay Pruitt in custody.  Bridget D Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
